comments.body:
Build.scala issue some parse exception, probably due to its special syntax:

> [info]   scala.meta.ParseException: XML literals are not supported at < (1751..1751)
> [info]   at scala.meta.internal.parsers.Reporter$class.syntaxError(Reporter.scala:13)
> [info]   at scala.meta.internal.parsers.Reporter$$anon$1.syntaxError(Reporter.scala:18)
> [info]   at scala.meta.internal.parsers.Parser.xmlLiteral(Parsers.scala:1230)
> [info]   at scala.meta.internal.parsers.Parser$$anonfun$simpleExpr$1.apply(Parsers.scala:1254)
> [info]   at scala.meta.internal.parsers.Parser$$anonfun$simpleExpr$1.apply(Parsers.scala:1245)
> [info]   at scala.meta.internal.parsers.Parser.atPos(Parsers.scala:277)
> [info]   at scala.meta.internal.parsers.Parser.autoPos(Parsers.scala:294)
> [info]   at scala.meta.internal.parsers.Parser.simpleExpr(Parsers.scala:1245)
> [info]   at scala.meta.internal.parsers.Parser.prefixExpr(Parsers.scala:1221)
> [info]   at scala.meta.internal.parsers.Parser.postfixExpr(Parsers.scala:1207)

Token.scala fails, because apparently the name of

``` scala
@token class `macro`(start: Int) extends Keywords
```

is named "macro" without `. (why?)

/semantic/Api.scala contains something of the form:

``` scala
internalFilter[T](that => {
              def thisDenot = thisName.denot.require[h.Denotation.Precomputed]
              def thatDenot = that.require[impl.Member].name.require[impl.Name].denot.require[h.Denotation.Precomputed]
              scala.util.Try(thisDenot.symbol == thatDenot.symbol).getOrElse(false)
            }) match {
        ...
        }
```

The starting line of the match contains `internalFilter[T](that => {` only, and therefore does not pass the test for `match`. To keep the test simple, I decided to avoid checking the Api.scala files.
